{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3335351,"name":null,"username":"Yuri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/yuri/{size}/218839_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T20:57:06.205Z","cooked":"

the entire backside of my redline motor was gone, including the brushes. i want to make this motor functional for non FRC usage, but i need a replacement brush and support. where can i find something like this ?

775s are really not designed for any sort of disassembly or repair. Buy a new one unless you happen to have another motor with brushes but a bad armature or something, and really want to screw around making a motor that will probably never run right.

its because i found this, and i want to know if it will fit.
this redline was thrown in the trash, and I took it for myself, so if it doesn’t turn out 100% efficient, it will be better than nothing

Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T22:46:45.679Z","cooked":"
Yuri:

its because i found this, and i want to know if it will fit.

The 775 is a reasonably standard format, and it’s cheap enough to try. For a science project, I say send it.

For what it’s worth, we used to run PVC pipe elbows to protect the backs of our RedLines. I want to say it was 1 1/4", but you may want to take one to a hardware store to verify.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-17T22:46:45.679Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":165,"readers_count":164,"score":33.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459004,"topic_slug":"does-exist-a-brush-replacement-for-a-redline-775","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52597,"username":"Patrick3357","name":"Patrick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/does-exist-a-brush-replacement-for-a-redline-775/459004/4","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3335437,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T22:47:39.598Z","cooked":"

Buy it, wait 3 months for it to show up in the mail, try it and see what you learn.

As long as you don’t hurt yourself or burn anything down, I don’t see this as a bad learning experience. Many FRC students only know “motor go spin”. Hands on knowledge tinkering is a powerful learning tool.

I agree with @Billfred
